intro: Peucedanum wawrae, commonly known as the Wawra's angelica, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other aromatic herbs like parsley and carrots. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in umbrella-shaped clusters. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, spicy aroma, similar to other members of its family. Peucedanum wawrae is often found in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions.
